Name: Surya Katakam
Title: Jai Bhukhi Mata
Review: Bhukhi mata temple is situated on the banks of river shipra close to Datta Akhara Ghat which was built by king Vikramaditya. Inside main temple two goddesses are seated on main stage. Two are believed to be sisters, one of them known as Bhukhi maa and other is known as Dhumavati. This temple is also called as Bhuvaneshwari Bhukhi mata mandir.  There are two lamp pillars in the temple, which are lit during Navaratri's. Every year on the eighth day of Navaratri, on the Occasion of Nagar puja and on the occasion of Simhashta (Which helds once in twelve years)  special worship is done by offering liquor to the mother.

Name: Sunnilbgautam
Title: Temple on bank of River Shipra
Review: This beautiful small temple located on the bank of river shipra on one side and road on another. This temple is very famous among locales.There always some feast (bhandara) aur Anushthaan happening almost every day.Must visit this temple for history and serene.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: Mata temple near shipra river
Review: Its one of the temple of goddess Mataji , in indian mythology there are multiple name for the same god and way of worship is different at different place.

Review: Bhukhi Mata Temple is located at bank of shipra river. this temple is dedicated to bhukhi mata. such  a peaceful place.

Title: Mata temple

Name: Prat C
Title: Tales,tales,tales!Lies,Lies,everywhere! Sincerest advice:"Read the scriptures"! And find the truth yourself!
Review: All the info is manipulated regarding many places in ujjain,The govt.of Madhya Pradesh themself have remodulated and modified many temples in ancient style to make people beleive that this is the "True Glorious Past of The Pradesh"! Well the truth is bitter,it is not so!

Name: yogindery
Title: Bhukhi Mata Temple
Review: Bhukhi Mata Temple is also best attraction of religious perone sight seeing place in ujjain.this is also a famous place for travelers coise.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Assocaited with Vikramaditya
Review: According to a popular belief associated with this temple, the goddesses of Ujjain demanded that a youth be sacrificed to them daily. The citizens were in great agony but they were helpless. Finally, one mother approached king Vikramaditya and demanded that he save her son. The king told the mother that he would appeal to the goddesses and if they did not agree he would sacrifice himself that day. Before night set in, the king arranged a huge feast. The flavours of different delicious dishes scented the air so much so that the appetites of the goddesses were appeased. They came to enjoy the food while the king hid himself below the table. On top of this table he had placed the replica of a man made of sweets. As the goddesses enjoyed the hearty meal and were about to leave, one of them happened to glance at the replica. She ate the replica and wondered aloud as to who could have kept it there. At that moment, Vikramaditya showed himself. The goddess asked him to express a wish. Vikramaditya requested that she should never cross to this side of the river. Pleased by his courage, she agreed. The goddess was Bhukhi Mata and the king made a temple in her honour on the other side of the river. Since then, she never came to trouble the people of Ujjain and no more young men were sacrificed.

Name: Saurabh K
Title: temple of bhookhi mata with some history
Review: this is a good temple situated at the bank of kshipra river. many historical story is related to this temple and king of ujjain (raja vikrmaditya.). this is a small temple. but it is crowded and during sinhastha and not clean. but rest of the year it is not much crowded and also clean. you wil get a view of kshipra river as well, which is a holy river according to Hindu religion.

Name: vipin360
Title: Too crowded on Simhastha occassion
Review: The temple is located on the banks of river Shipra. One can get an excellent view of the newly constructed Narsimha Ghat where one can get a holi dip.

Name: guptaashok_0511
Title: Relegious Place
Review: This is a very popular place among locals. The temple is across the Ramghat. A very simple temple. It has 2 deities.
